page.title: 11Felton Village Hall
page.content: Felton Village Hall is a red brick building. It was built in 1929. It is run by a management committee consisting of four independent members and a representative from each local organisation. It has been used for many purposes. During the Second World War it was a cinema for troops stationed in the village. Now it is used for the following things : 1.BADMINTON 2.CARPET BOWLS 3.MEETINGS OF VARIOUS GROUPS 4.WHIST DRIVES AND BINGO. It is also used as a polling station for county and national elections. Mr.R.Scott,better known as "Scotty Bob"is the caretaker. The land where the village hall is now used to be Willis's woodyard. A man called Riddell gave the land for the village hall to be built on in memory of the 1st World Wars returning soldiers
